note:
亚马逊正在努力扩大其食品杂货业务-不是已经拥有500多家门店的全食超市(Whole Foods)，而是其亚马逊品牌的免注册门店系列。虽然顾客携带一小袋商品在便利店里转悠很容易，就像亚马逊第一次开业时那样，但要搬运他们经常在普通超市购买的大量食品就难得多了。在亚马逊的第一次购物中，顾客携带一小袋东西在便利店里逛来逛去很容易，但在普通超市里经常买到的杂货量却要大得多。因此，亚马逊正在做亚马逊所做的事情，并将购物车本身作为其高科技零售体验的重要组成部分。
亚马逊公司今天表示，亚马逊Dash购物车将于今年晚些时候与该公司在洛杉矶的超市一起推出。智能购物车要求顾客使用手机上的亚马逊应用程序登录购物车，然后使用摄像头和传感器系统来盘点购物者放在篮子里的东西。它的前手柄上还有一个触摸屏面板，因此消费者可以购买没有条形码的商品，比如新鲜农产品。当购物者完成他们的食品杂货之旅时，他们会推着手推车走出仪表道，抓起他们现在付钱买的食品，然后漫步离开。
亚马逊的免收银员便利店于2017年首次向公众开放。今年早些时候，该公司紧随其后，在西雅图开设了一家稍大的Amazon Go杂货店，Ars&39；的老板山姆·马奇科维奇(Sam Machkovech)对这家店进行了测试，看看Panopticon超市的设置到底有多准确。(剧透：它不是完全万无一失，但它可以识别你是否试图偷香蕉。)。
这款购物车基本上采用了Amazon Go商店背后的技术，使其具有移动性，它结合了计算机视觉算法和传感器融合技术，在你将物品放入购物车时进行识别和扫描。亚马逊副总裁迪利普·库马尔说：我们建立这个网站的主要动机是能够节省客户的时间。另一种解决方案是站在快速结账通道，或者在自助结账站摸索。
言下之意是，随着占地面积较小的Amazon Go和Amazon Go杂货店的建成，亚马逊即将开业的全尺寸超市连锁店--在尚未开业的洛杉矶门店之后，还计划再开设5家门店--实在太大了，无法在天花板的每一平方英寸都安装摄像头。取而代之的是，基于购物车的购物选项基本上与传统杂货零售商Giant和Stop&amp；Shop使用的Scan-It应用程序类似，只是内置在购物车中。然而，这些系统远不是完美无缺的，而且似乎购物车也可能存在一些可利用的错误。
也许亚马逊留下的最大悬而未决的问题是：这些手推车是否足够聪明，能够感知到它们何时被留在了停车位中央或公交车站，就像大多数标准超市手推车的命运一样？
note_en:
Amazon is working to expand its grocery business—not Whole Foods, which already has more than 500 store locations, but its Amazon-branded line of register-free stores. While it's easy for a customer to carry a small bag of items around a convenience store like in the first Amazon Go, it's a lot harder to schlep around the volume of groceries one often buys at a regular supermarket. So Amazon is doing what Amazon does and is making the shopping cart itself an essential part of its high-tech retail experience.
 The Amazon  Dash cart will launch along with the company's Los Angeles supermarket later this year, the company said today. The smart cart requires a customer to log in to the cart using the Amazon app on their phone, then uses a system of cameras and sensors to take stock of what a shopper puts in the basket. It also has a touchscreen panel on the front handle, so consumers can purchase items that don't have barcodes, such as fresh produce. When a shopper is done with their grocery trip, they roll the cart out of the "dash lane," grab their now paid-for groceries, and saunter away.
 Amazon's camera-heavy, cashier-free convenience stores first  opened to the public in 2017. Earlier this year, the company followed suit with a slightly larger Amazon Go Grocery location in Seattle, which Ars' own Sam Machkovech  tested to see exactly how accurate the panopticon supermarket setup is. (Spoiler: It's not completely foolproof, but it can identify if you try to steal a banana.)
 The cart basically takes the technology behind the Amazon Go stores and makes it mobile, using "a combination of computer vision algorithms and sensor fusion" to ID and scan items as you place them inside the cart. "Our primary motivation for building this was to be able to save customers time," Amazon VP Dilip Kumar said. "The alternative solutions are standing in the express checkout lanes or fumbling through self-checkout stations."
 The implication is that the stores in Amazon's impending full-size supermarket chain—there are five more locations planned after the as-yet unopened Los Angeles store—are simply too large to fill every square inch of the ceiling with cameras, as the smaller-footprint Amazon Go and Amazon Go Grocery stores are built. Instead, the cart-based shopping option basically works like the Scan-It app at use in traditional grocery retailers Giant and Stop & Shop, except built into the cart. Those systems, however, are  far from flawless, and it seems as though the carts might also have some exploitable errors.
 Perhaps the biggest unanswered question Amazon has left hanging: are the carts smart enough to sense when they've been left in the middle of a parking space or at a bus stop, as seems to be the fate for most standard supermarket trolleys?
title: 亚马逊超市开业后将推出别致的新智能车
title_en: Amazon supermarket will roll out fancy new smart cart when it opens

note:
橡树设备使用他们的摄像头和板载AI芯片来执行一系列计算机视觉任务，比如识别物体，计数人，找出帧中物体之间的距离，等等。此信息以精美的、随时可用的形式发送。
拥有这样一个可靠、低成本、低功耗的绘图计算机视觉单元，对于任何希望建造智能设备或机器人的人来说都是一个巨大的福音，否则这些设备或机器人可能需要几个独立的摄像头和其他芯片(更不用说需要相当多的软件摆弄了)。
与Raspberry PI一样，Raspberry PI已经成长为涉足硬件的业余程序员的首选，几乎所有关于这些设备的东西都是经过麻省理工学院许可的开源设备。它是OpenCV的正式成员，OpenCV是计算机视觉世界中广泛使用的一套库和标准。
实际的设备和车载人工智能是由Luxonis创造的，该公司之前创造了CommuteGuardian，这是一种自行车的智能刹车灯，可以实时跟踪物体，以便向骑车人发出警告。团队找不到任何符合要求的硬件，所以他们自己制作了，然后与OpenCV合作，制作了Oak系列作为后续产品。
它实际上有两个版本：超小型Oak-1和三摄像头Oak-D。它们共享许多组件，但Oak-D的多个摄像头单元意味着它可以进行真正的立体3D视觉，而不是依赖于普通RGB图像中的其他线索-这些技术现在比以往任何时候都要好，但真正的立体仍然是一个很大的优势。(如果你想知道，人类视觉系统会同时使用两者。)。
这个想法是将计算机视觉系统统一起来，这样就不需要建造或配置它，这可以帮助许多项目更快地启动。您可以使用现成的对象和深度检测功能，或者选择您想要的元数据，并使用它来增强您自己对同样通过的4K(外加两个720p)图像的分析。
非常低的功率也会有所帮助。计算机视觉任务对处理器的要求可能相当高，因此会消耗大量电力，这就是为什么像XNOR的超高效芯片这样的设备如此有前途(也是该公司被苹果抢购一空的原因)。Oak设备不会将事情带到XNOR的极端，但最大功耗为几瓦，根据任务的不同，它们可以使用正常大小的电池连续运行数天或数周。
这些细节无疑会让那些知道这些东西的来龙去脉的人感兴趣-端口、电缆和gihub存储库等等-但我不会在这里重复它们，因为它们都在竞选文案中有序地列出。以下是快速版本：
如果这似乎是你的项目或实验室可以利用的东西，你可能想要快速进入Kickstarter，因为对于早起的人有一些很大的折扣，而且零售价会翻一番。Oak-1的价格为79美元，Oak-D的价格为129美元，根据它们宣称的性能，我觉得这听起来很划算(它们最终的价格将分别为199美元和299美元)。LUXONIS和OpenCV也不是不靠谱的机构，所以你可以有信心地支持这项活动。此外，他们在大约一个小时内飞过了他们的目标，所以没有必要担心这一点。
note_en:
The OAK devices use their cameras and onboard AI chip to perform a number of computer vision tasks, like identifying objects, counting people, finding distances to and between things in frame, and more. This info is sent out in polished, ready-to-use form.
 Having a reliable, low cost, low power draw computer vision unit like this is a great boon for anyone looking to build a smart device or robot that might have otherwise required several and discrete cameras and other chips (not to mention quite a bit of fiddling with software).
   Like the Raspberry Pi, which has grown to become the first choice for hobbyist programmers dabbling in hardware, pretty much everything about these devices is open source on the permissive MIT license. And it’s officially affiliated with OpenCV, a widespread set of libraries and standards used in the computer vision world.
 The actual device and onboard AI were created by  Luxonis,   which previously created the  CommuteGuardian, a sort of smart brake light for bikes that tracks objects in real time so it can warn the rider. The team couldn’t find any hardware that fit the bill so they made their own, and then collaborated with OpenCV to make the OAK series as a follow-up.
 There are actually two versions: The extra-small OAK-1 and triple-camera OAK-D. They share many components, but the OAK-D’s multiple camera units mean it can do true stereoscopic 3D vision rather than relying on other cues in the plain RGB image — these techniques are better now than ever but true stereo is still a big advantage. (The human vision system uses both, in case you’re wondering.)
  The idea was to unitize the computer vision system so there’s no need to build or configure it, which could help get a lot of projects off the ground faster. You can use the baked-in object and depth detection out of the box, or pick and choose the metadata you want and use it to augment your own analysis of the 4K (plus two 720p) images that also come through.
 A very low power draw helps, too. Computer vision tasks can be fairly demanding on processors and thus use a lot of power, which was why a device like  XNOR’s ultra-efficient chip was so promising (and why that company got snapped up by Apple). The OAK devices don’t take things to XNOR extremes but with a maximum power draw of a handful of watts, they could run on normal-sized batteries for days or weeks on end depending on their task.
 The specifics will no doubt be interesting to those who know the ins and outs of such things — ports and cables and GitHub repositories and so on — but I won’t duplicate them here, as they’re all listed in orderly fashion in the campaign copy. Here’s the quick version:
  If this seems like something your project or lab could make use of, you might want to  get in quick on the Kickstarter, as there are some deep discounts for early birds, and the price will double at retail. $79 for the OAK-1 and $129 for the OAK-D sound like bargains to me based on their stated capabilities (they’ll be $199 and 299 eventually). And Luxonis and OpenCV are hardly fly-by-night organizations hocking vaporware, so you can back the campaign with confidence. Also, they flew past their goal in like an hour, so no need to worry about that.
title: OpenCV AI Kit的目标是实现计算机视觉，就像Raspberry Pi为业余硬件所做的那样
title_en: OpenCV AI Kit aims to do for computer vision what Raspberry Pi did for hobbyist hardware

note:
从ClassPass到Knotel，桑哈维带领几家企业实现了增长，估值超过10亿美元，现在他正寻求将这种品牌和营销头脑带到可再生能源领域，担任阿卡迪亚的新任首席产品官。
该公司通过购买等量的可再生电力或投资于提供可再生信用以抵消化石燃料使用的可再生能源项目，来抵消客户的用电量，从而鼓励可再生能源的发展。
阿卡迪亚的创始人兼首席执行官基兰·巴特拉朱(Kiran Bhatraju)在一份声明中说，“我们创立阿卡迪亚是为了凝聚消费者需求的力量，以应对气候变化。”桑吉夫在创造和制造引人入胜的消费产品方面的深厚知识将在未来几年帮助我们继续建立人们热爱和地球需要的世界级家庭能源体验。“。
Sanghavi将是阿卡迪亚向东北部扩张不可或缺的一部分，因为它希望在美国各地扩大足迹。
在过去的六个月里，阿卡迪亚在其纽约办事处工作人员的同时，稳步地在大西洋沿岸建立了自己的存在。该公司增加了一位设计高级副总裁乔希·艾布拉姆斯(Josh Abrams)，他曾在DoorDash、WeWork和PayPal工作过，目前正在积极招聘。
“我被阿卡迪亚吸引是因为它持久的力量；我想建造一些能对几代人产生影响的东西，”桑哈维说。“我相信阿卡迪亚正在做的事情是令人震惊的--我们正在搭建一座桥梁，将那些对可再生能源进行基因评级的人与那些想要做好事的人联系起来。”
根据Crunchbase的数据，到目前为止，该公司已经从G2VP、BoxGroup、Wonder Ventures和Energy Impact Partners等投资者那里筹集了7000万美元。
note_en:
From  ClassPass   through Knotel, Sanghavi has shepherded several businesses to growth and over a billion dollar valuations, now he’s looking to bring that branding and marketing savvy to the world of renewable energy as the new chief product officer at  Arcadia.
 The company encourages renewable energy development by offsetting its customers’ electricity usage by buying an equivalent amount of renewable power or investing in renewable energy projects that provide renewable credits to offset fossil fuel usage.
  “ We founded Arcadia to aggregate the power of consumer demand to fight climate change,” said Kiran Bhatraju, the founder and chief executive at Arcadia, in a statement. “Sanjiv’s deep knowledge of creating and building engaging consume r products will be crucial in the coming years to help us continue to build a world-class home energy experience that people love, and the planet needs.”
 Sanghavi will be integral to Arcadia’s expansion into the northeast as it looks to grow its footprint across the United States.
 Over the past six months Arcadia has steadily built out its presence across the Atlantic seaboard as it staffs its New York office. The company added a senior vice president of design who previously worked at DoorDash, WeWork, and PayPal, Josh Abrams, and is actively hiring.
 “ I was drawn to Arcadia because of its lasting power; I wanted to build something that would make an impact for generations,” said Sanghavi. “I believe that what Arcadia is doing is astounding — we’re building a bridge from the people who are gene rating renewable energy to those who want to do something good.”
 The company has raised $70 million to date,  according to Crunchbase, from investors including G2VP, BoxGroup, Wonder Ventures and Energy Impact Partners.
title: ClassPass联合创始人Sanjiv Sanghavi加入Arcadia，为清洁能源带来消费者营销头脑
title_en: ClassPass co-founder Sanjiv Sanghavi joins Arcadia, bringing consumer marketing savvy to clean energy

note:
Medly Pharmacy是一家总部位于纽约州布鲁克林的数字药店，该公司在由Greycroft和Will Capital共同牵头的B轮融资中筹集了1亿美元。
此次加薪正值数字医疗蓬勃发展之际，这在很大程度上要归功于新冠肺炎危机实施的社会疏远措施。Medly成立于2017年，将自己吹捧为一家“全方位”药房，负责验证和提交保险索赔，协调处方交付，并直接与患者合作，管理对药物的依从性、副作用和续药。
Medly在去年的首轮融资中筹集了一笔数额不详的资金，通过新的现金注入，该公司有充足的资金打入价值5000亿美元的美国处方药市场，并在其现有的1.5万家供应商和5万名患者的用户基础上再接再厉。Medly目前与纽约、新泽西、宾夕法尼亚、马里兰州和迈阿密的五家药店合作，目前正寻求在美国各地扩张到新的地点。
Truepill也在向远程医疗领域扩张，上周筹集了2500万美元。在过去几个月里获得可观资金的其他竞争对手包括Medici和Tyto Care，前者类似于远程医疗的WhatsApp，后者提供远程医疗检查和诊断平台。这个领域的其他参与者包括强大的亚马逊，它在2018年收购了在线药店PillPack。
note_en:
Medly Pharmacy, a Brooklyn, NY-headquartered digital pharmacy, has raised $100 million in a series B round of funding co-led by Greycroft and Volition Capital.
 The raise comes amid a boom in digital health care, due in large part to social distancing measures enforced by the COVID-19 crisis. Founded in 2017, Medly touts itself as a “full-service” pharmacy that validates and files insurance claims, coordinates prescription deliveries, and works directly with patients to manage adherence to medication, side effects, and refills.
  Medly  raised an undisclosed amount in its series A round last year, and with its fresh cash injection the company is well-financed to infiltrate  the $500 billion U.S. drug prescription market and build on its existing user base of 15,000 providers and 50,000 patients. Medly currently works with five pharmacies across New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Maryland, and Miami, and it is now looking to expand into new locations across the U.S.
 Truepill, which is also expanding into telehealth,  raised $25 million last week. Other rivals that have secured sizable sums over the past few months include Medici, which is like  a WhatsApp for remote medical care, and  Tyto Care, which offers a telehealth examination and diagnostic platform. Other players in this sphere include the mighty Amazon,  which acquired online pharmacy  PillPack back in 2018.
title: 总部位于布鲁克林的Medly Pharmacy提供“全方位服务”的数字药房，由Greycroft和Will Capital共同牵头筹集1亿美元的B系列资金
title_en: Brooklyn-based Medly Pharmacy, which offers a “full-service” digital pharmacy, raises $100M Series B co-led by Greycroft and Volition Capital

note:
法兰克福(路透社)-慕尼黑的一名法官周二裁定，德国已禁止特斯拉重复法院所说的与该公司驾驶员辅助系统能力和自动驾驶有关的误导性广告声明。
这起案件是由德国的Wettbewerbszentrale提起的，Wettbewerbszentrale是一个行业赞助的机构，负责监管反竞争行为。
慕尼黑法院同意该行业组织的评估，并禁止特斯拉德国公司在其德国广告材料中包含“自动驾驶的全部潜力”和“Autopilot Include”。
该公司表示，此类说法相当于误导性的商业行为，并补充称，普通买家可能会给人一种印象，认为汽车可以在没有人为干预的情况下行驶，并可能暗示这样的系统现在德国道路上是合法的。
特斯拉的自动驾驶系统招致包括美国国家运输安全委员会(National Transportation Safety Board)在内的监管机构的批评，称其缺乏保障措施。
人们对辅助系统的担忧与日俱增，这种系统可以在很少或根本没有人工干预的情况下执行长时间的驾驶任务，这会诱使司机忽视他们时刻控制车辆的义务。
特斯拉表示，它已经通知客户，其自动驾驶辅助技术并不等于完全自动驾驶系统。
记者无法立即联系到特斯拉德国公司的发言人对周二的裁决发表评论。
特斯拉首席执行官埃隆·马斯克(Elon Musk)本月表示，这家电动汽车制造商即将使其汽车能够自动驾驶，而不需要任何司机输入，即所谓的5级自动驾驶。
note_en:
FRANKFURT (Reuters) - Germany has banned Tesla from repeating what a court says are misleading advertising statements relating to the capabilities of the firm’s driver assistance systems and to autonomous driving, a Munich judge ruled on Tuesday.
   The case was brought by Germany’s Wettbewerbszentrale, an industry sponsored body tasked with policing anti-competitive practices.
 The Munich court agreed with the industry body’s assessment and banned Tesla Germany from including “full potential for autonomous driving” and “Autopilot inclusive” in its German advertising materials.
 It said such claims amounted to misleading business practices, adding that the average buyer might be given the impression that the car could drive without human intervention and might suggest such a system was now legal on German roads.
 Tesla’s autopilot system has drawn criticism from regulators, including from the National Transportation Safety Board in the United States, saying it lacks safeguards.
 Concerns have grown about assistance systems that can perform driving tasks for extended stretches with little or no human intervention, tempting drivers to neglect their obligation to be in control of their vehicles at all times.
 Tesla has said it has informed customers that its automated driver assistance technology did not amount to a fully autonomous driving system.
 A spokeswoman for Tesla Germany was not immediately available to comment on Tuesday’s ruling.
 Tesla’s Chief Executive Elon Musk said this month the electric car manufacturer was close to making its cars capable of automated driving without any need for driver input, so-called Level 5 autonomy.
title: 慕尼黑法院禁止特斯拉德国公司在德国广告中使用“全自动驾驶潜力”和“包括自动驾驶”等术语，称其具有误导性
title_en: Munich court bars Tesla Germany from using the terms “full potential for autonomous driving” and “Autopilot inclusive” in German ads, calling them misleading

note:
数据保护局(DPA)周二宣布，谷歌比利时被数据保护局(DPA)处以60万欧元的罚款，原因是该搜索引擎没有尊重公民被遗忘的权利。
“被遗忘权必须在公众获取信息的权利和数据主体的权益之间取得正确的平衡，”DPA诉讼分庭主任海尔克·希曼斯(Hielke Hijmans)说。
谷歌收到了一位“凭借其职能在比利时公众生活中扮演重要角色”的人的请求，要求从搜索引擎中删除与他名字相关的搜索结果。
据报道，这些搜索结果涉及到可能与一个政党有联系，并提到了很久以前就被宣布为毫无根据的骚扰投诉。
谷歌拒绝删除搜索结果。根据诉讼分庭的说法，考虑到可能与某个政党有联系，这是合理的，但谷歌应该删除有关骚扰投诉的内容。
DPA裁定：“由于针对原告的指控没有成立，而且是陈旧的，很可能对原告造成严重后果，因此必须以当事人的权益为准。”
根据DPA的说法，谷歌“特别疏忽”，因为它“有证据表明事实是无关的和过时的。”
这笔罚款比DPA迄今开出的最高罚单(5万欧元)高出十倍以上。
note_en:
Google Belgium was imposed a fine of €600,000 by the Data Protection Authority (DPA) because the search engine did not respect a citizen’s right to be forgotten, the DPA announced on Tuesday.
 “The right to be forgotten must strike the correct balance between, on the one hand, the public’s right of access to information and, on the other hand, the rights and interests of the data subject,” said Hielke Hijmans, Director of the DPA’s Litigation Chamber.
   Google had received a request from someone, “who by virtue of his function plays a role in public life in Belgium,” to remove the search results linked to his name from the search engine.
    These search results reportedly involved references to possible links with a political party and references to a harassment complaint that was declared unfounded a long time ago.
 Google refused to delete the search results. According to the Litigation Chamber, this was justified with regard to possible links with a political party, but Google should have removed the references to the harassment complaint.
 “Since the allegations against the plaintiff were not established, are old and are likely to have serious consequences for the complainant, the rights and interests of the person concerned must prevail,” the DPA ruled.
   Google was “particularly negligent” according to the DPA, because it “had evidence that the facts were irrelevant and outdated.”
 The fine is more than ten times higher than the highest fine imposed so far by the DPA (€50,000).
title: 谷歌在比利时面临60万欧元的隐私罚款
title_en: Google faces €600k privacy fine in Belgium

note:
几个月来，纽约市首次出现了24小时内没有人死于冠状病毒的情况。
纽约市卫生与心理卫生局(New York City Department Of Health And Mental Hygiene)周六报告称，死亡人数为零，但这个数字可能会发生变化，因为死亡数据可能会滞后，而且可以随时追溯确认新的死亡人数。该市首例证实的冠状病毒死亡病例是在3月11日。
市长比尔·白思豪(Bill De Blasio)称这一里程碑是关于这座城市如何反击，人们从未屈服的声明。
这是应该让我们充满希望的事情，但要绕胜利一圈是非常困难的，因为我们知道我们前面还有很多。白思豪在周一的新闻发布会上说，这种疾病远未被击败。我们环顾全国，看看其他这么多美国人正在经历什么，还有这么多其他州和城市现在正遭受如此严重的伤害。所以没有人可以庆祝，但我们至少可以花一点时间来感谢你们每一个人为让我们走到这一步所做的如此多的努力。
纽约市已有18,708人确认死于新冠肺炎，还有4,615人可能死亡。
市长说，二十四小时无人死亡。让我们拥有更多这样的日子。
白思豪还呼吁特朗普总统援引国防生产法案，加快冠状病毒检测的处理速度：
总统先生，你所要做的就是说，我现在援引“国防生产法案”来扩大在美利坚合众国的实验室能力，以确保我们有一切所需的东西，可以迅速地把测试送到人们手中。你可以大笔一挥地做到这一点。我们不仅在纽约这里需要它，整个国家都需要它。
市长说，联邦政府现在必须加快步伐，因为现在它正在成为一场全国性的危机。我们过去几乎没有什么测试。现在我们有了更多的测试，但是如果你不能实时得到结果，这对你的帮助是不够的。
在该市冠状病毒病例大幅减少的同时，有一个令人担忧的趋势：年轻人的感染率不断上升，特别是20至29岁的年轻人。
白思豪说：我理解对于这么多年轻人来说，这是一段非常艰难的时期--与世隔绝，远离所爱的人。我理解人们只是渴望摆脱这种状况，但是-我们必须不断地告诉每个人，尤其是我们的年轻人，坚持有效的做法是多么重要：社交距离，面罩，接受测试。
该市计划通过社交媒体影响力人士、面具赠品和移动测试车将其覆盖到年轻人。在布朗克斯、布鲁克林和皇后区还将有10个新的免费、无电梯测试点。
随着越来越多的人回到室内工作，重新乘坐地铁，白思豪敦促纽约人无论何时在家外的室内都要戴上面罩，即使其他人离他们不太近。
周一，该市报告冠状病毒检测的阳性评级为2%。56名患者入院，279名患者在重症监护病房。
title: 纽约市几个月来第一天没有新冠肺炎死亡
title_en: NYC Has Its First Day in Months with No Covid-19 Deaths

note:
法兰克福-周二，慕尼黑的一名法官裁定，德国禁止特斯拉重复法院所说的关于该公司驾驶员辅助系统和自动驾驶能力的误导性广告声明。
此案是由德国的Wettbewerbszentrale提起的，这是一个由行业赞助的机构，负责监管反竞争行为。
慕尼黑法院同意该行业组织的评估，并禁止特斯拉德国公司在其德国广告材料中包含自动驾驶的全部潜力和Autopilot Included。
该公司表示，此类说法相当于误导性的商业行为，并补充称，普通买家可能会给人一种印象，认为汽车可以在没有人为干预的情况下行驶，并可能暗示这样的系统现在德国道路上是合法的。
特斯拉的自动驾驶系统招致了监管机构的批评，包括美国国家运输安全委员会(National Transportation Safety Board)，称其缺乏保障措施。
人们对辅助系统的担忧与日俱增，这种系统可以在很少或根本没有人工干预的情况下执行长时间的驾驶任务，这会诱使司机忽视他们时刻控制车辆的义务。
特斯拉表示，它已经通知客户，其自动驾驶辅助技术并不等于完全自动驾驶系统。
特斯拉首席执行官埃隆·马斯克(Elon Musk)本月表示，这家电动汽车制造商即将使其汽车能够自动驾驶，而不需要任何司机输入，即所谓的5级自动驾驶。
(Alexander Huebner报道；Edward Taylor编写；Tom Sims和Edmund Blair编辑)
note_en:
FRANKFURT — Germany has banned Tesla from repeating what a court says are misleading advertising statements relating to the capabilities of the firm's driver assistance systems and to autonomous driving, a Munich judge ruled on Tuesday.
  The case was brought by Germany's Wettbewerbszentrale, an industry sponsored body tasked with policing anti-competitive practices.
 The Munich court agreed with the industry body's assessment and banned Tesla Germany from including "full potential for autonomous driving" and "Autopilot inclusive" in its German advertising materials.
 It said such claims amounted to misleading business practices, adding that the average buyer might be given the impression that the car could drive without human intervention and might suggest such a system was now legal on German roads.
 Tesla's autopilot system has drawn criticism from regulators, including from the National Transportation Safety Board in the United States, saying it lacks safeguards.
 Concerns have grown about assistance systems that can perform driving tasks for extended stretches with little or no human intervention, tempting drivers to neglect their obligation to be in control of their vehicles at all times.
 Tesla has said it has informed customers that its automated driver assistance technology did not amount to a fully autonomous driving system.
  Tesla's Chief Executive Elon Musk said this month the electric car manufacturer was close to making its cars capable of automated driving without any need for driver input, so-called Level 5 autonomy.
 (Reporting by Alexander Huebner; Writing by Edward Taylor; Editing by Tom Sims and Edmund Blair)
title: 德国法院禁止特斯拉与自动驾驶相关的广告声明
title_en: German Court Bans Tesla Ad Statements Related to Autonomous Driving

note:
格兰特·今原(Grant Imahara)是一名机器人学家和电气工程师，他的作品曾出现在电影和电视剧中，如《星球大战I：幽灵的威胁》(The Star Wars I：The Phantom Menace)、《黑客帝国重装》(The Matrix Reloded)和《流言终结者》(The MythBusters)。周一，他在脑动脉瘤后突然去世。他现年49岁。
今原在传奇特效公司Industrial Light and Magic工作了九年，在那里他参与了“星球大战：人工智能”、“银河探索”、“终结者3：机器的崛起”等电影的制作，这是“黑客帝国”的两部续集，以及乔治·卢卡斯的“星球大战”前传三部曲。最后，他负责为新电影修复和重建标志性的R2D2机器人。今原还创作了喜剧机器人杰夫·彼得森(Geoff Petersen)，这位喜剧机器人与克雷格·弗格森(Craig Ferguson)共同主持了《深夜秀》(The Late Late Show)。
但他最为大多数人所熟知的可能是多年来与托里·贝莱奇(Tory Belleci)和卡里·拜伦(Kari Byron)共同主持的《流言终结者》(The MythBuster)的构建团队成员。在节目中，Imahara经常被描绘成团队中的极客，因为他致力于机器人和计算机的工作，这些机器人和计算机与系列剧过程中测试的神话有关。他在银幕上是一个具有感染力的积极个性，受到粉丝的喜爱。
他也是真人角色扮演的粉丝，在许多在线社区，以及洛杉矶机器人、科学和极客文化的社交场景中，他都是一个广为人知和受人尊敬的人物。朋友和同事们都记得他是一个脚踏实地、热情、积极向上的人。
面对他的逝世，他的前同事、朋友和其他他感动过的人表达了悲痛之情。“流言终结者”主持人亚当·萨维奇写道：“我茫然不知所措。”&#34；无话可说。在过去的22年里，我一直是格兰特·今原的两个大家庭的一员。格兰特是一位真正才华横溢的工程师、艺术家和表演者，但也是一个慷慨、随和、温和的人。和格兰特一起工作太有趣了。我会想念我的朋友的。
流言终结者的同事Build团队成员Kari Byron和Tory Belleci也表达了悲痛。我希望我有一台时光机，拜伦在推特上写道，旁边还有一张与她、贝莱奇和今原的合影。我简直不敢相信。我甚至不知道该说什么。贝莱奇写道：我的心都碎了。
今原留下了长期合作伙伴珍妮弗·纽曼(Jennifer Newman)，她是一名服装设计师。她在推特上写道：今天我失去了内心和灵魂的一部分。他是如此慷慨和善良，如此甜蜜，如此受他难以置信的朋友们的喜爱。认识他，爱过他和被他爱过，我感到非常幸运。
note_en:
Grant Imahara, a roboticist and electrical engineer whose work appeared in films and TV series such as  Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace,  The Matrix Reloaded, and  MythBusters, died  suddenly on Monday following a brain aneurysm. He was 49 years old.
 Imahara worked for nine years at storied special-effects firm Industrial Light and Magic, where he worked on films such as  A.I: Artificial Intelligence,  Galaxy Quest,  Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines, the two sequels to  The Matrix, and George Lucas'  Star Wars prequel trilogy. On the last of those, he was responsible for restoring and recreating the iconic R2D2 robot for the new films. Imahara also created Geoff Petersen, the comedic robot co-host from  The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson.
 But he is probably best-known to most people as a member of the build team on  MythBusters for many years, with co-hosts Tory Belleci and Kari Byron. On the show, Imahara was often portrayed as the geek of the group as he worked on robots and computers related to the myths that were tested over the course of the series. He was an infectiously positive personality on screen and was beloved by fans.
 He was also a fan of live-action role-playing and was a widely known and well-regarded figure in many online communities, as well as in the Los Angeles robotics, science, and geek culture social scenes. He is remembered by friends and colleagues as a down-to-earth, warm, and positive human being.
 His passing was met by an outpouring of grief from former co-workers, friends, and others whose lives he touched. "I’m at a loss,"  wrote MythBusters host Adam Savage. "No words. I’ve been part of two big families with Grant Imahara over the last 22 years. Grant was a truly brilliant engineer, artist, and performer, but also just such a generous, easygoing, and gentle PERSON. Working with Grant was so much fun. I’ll miss my friend."
 Fellow MythBusters build team members Kari Byron and Tory Belleci also expressed grief. "I wish I had a time machine," Byron  tweeted alongside a photo with her, Belleci, and Imahara. "I just cannot believe it. I don’t even know what to say. My heart is broken,"  wrote Belleci.
 Imahara is survived by long-time partner Jennifer Newman, a costume designer. "I lost a part of my heart and soul today," she wrote  on Twitter. "He was so generous and kind, so endlessly sweet and so loved by his incredible friends. I feel so lucky to have known him, to have loved & been loved by him."
title: 卢卡斯电影公司和流言终结者机器人专家格兰特·今原去世
title_en: Lucasfilm and MythBusters roboticist Grant Imahara has passed away

今天Dealmaster的头条新闻是Razer的Viper Ultimate无线游戏鼠标的新低价，作为Razer游戏产品为期一天的金盒促销活动的一部分，目前亚马逊上的价格已降至100美元。正常情况下，毒蛇终极版在网上的零售价接近130美元。
在我们的最佳无线鼠标指南中，毒蛇终极版是最好的游戏推荐。它是昂贵的，即使在这个折扣的价格，但它是巨大的舒适性和性能。它很轻，只有74克，虽然相对平坦的形状让它比手掌握把更适合抓爪子和指尖，但它的大小足以让大多数人感到舒适。它主要是由塑料制成的，但它结构紧凑，有抓人的橡胶边，弹性的点击按钮，以及滑动顺畅的聚四氟乙烯脚。它的滚轮可以更快，但它是精确的，虽然不幸的是它使用的是microUSB而不是USB-C，但它可以使用附带的(高度灵活的)电缆。它确实在鼠标前面的徽标中内置了少量的RGB照明，但对于游戏鼠标来说，它的影响微乎其微，足以在办公室环境下工作。
除此之外，毒蛇终极版应该不会出现准确性、延迟或响应性方面的问题。它具有很高的跟踪速度(高达650 IPS)和150到20,000的巨大CPI范围。你永远不需要把灵敏度提高那么多，但既然你可以以50CPI为增量进行调整，所有这一切都意味着你有空间将鼠标微调到你觉得舒适的地方，无论是用于紧张的射击游戏还是日常办公室工作。您可以在鼠标本身的五个不同的敏感度预设之间进行切换。这也是一个真正的双面灵巧的设计，两边各有一对宏键，所以左撇子不会被冷落。
不过，如果你不能证明在鼠标上花这么多钱是合理的，我们还有Fitbit健身跟踪器、AMD Ryzen处理器、任天堂Switch Pro控制器、亚马逊Echo设备等等的优惠。你可以看看下面的完整摘要。

note_en:
Today's Dealmaster is headlined by a new low price for Razer's Viper Ultimate wireless gaming mouse, which is  currently down to $100 on Amazon as part of a  wider one-day Gold Box sale on Razer gaming products. Normally, the Viper Ultimate retails closer to $130 online.
 The Viper Ultimate is the top gaming recommendation in  our guide to the best wireless mice. It's expensive, even at this discounted price, but it's tremendous in both comfort and performance. It's lightweight at 74 grams, and while its relatively flat shape makes it a bit better for  claw and fingertip grips than palm grips, it's sized well enough to be comfortable for most people. It's primarily made of plastic, but it's tightly built, with grippy rubberized sides, springy click buttons, and PTFE feet that glide smoothly. Its scroll wheel could be quicker, but it's precise, and while it unfortunately uses microUSB instead of USB-C, it can work with an included (and highly flexible) cable. It does have a modicum of RGB lighting built into the logo on the front of the mouse, but for a gaming mouse, its effects are minimal enough to work in an office setting.
 Beyond that, the Viper Ultimate should present no issues with accuracy, latency, or responsiveness. It has a high tracking speed (up to 650 IPS) and a massive CPI range of 150 to 20,000. You'll never need to increase the sensitivity  that much, but since you can adjust it in 50 CPI increments, all this means you have room to fine tune the mouse to a place you find comfortable, be it for twitchy shooter games or everyday office work. You can swap between five different sensitivity presets from the mouse itself. This is also a truly ambidextrous design, with a pair of macro buttons on either side, so lefties aren't left out in the cold.
 If you can't justify spending that much on a mouse, though, we also have deals on Fitbit fitness trackers, AMD Ryzen processors, the Nintendo Switch Pro Controller, Amazon Echo devices, and much more. You can take a look at the full rundown below.

note:
与Apple Arade不同的是，Google Play Pass提供了游戏和高端应用的组合，比如AccuWeather，Facune和Pic Stitch。它还包括一系列值得注意的发射游戏，如Stardew Valley、Risk、Terraria、纪念碑谷、“星球大战：旧共和国的骑士”、“统治：权力的游戏”、“泰坦任务”和“任性的灵魂”。
自上市以来，该公司的阵容一直在稳步增长。谷歌表示，在过去的几个月里，它增加了150多款游戏，并准备推出更多。一系列新游戏也将于今年在Google Play Pass上首发，首先是最新发布的现已上市的“几乎消失的游戏”(The Gear Gone From PlayDigous)。紧随其后的是The Gardens Better and王国Rush，然后是今年晚些时候发布的新片，如Rogue的Bright Paw和该品牌的Line Weight。
该公司还提供了一种不同的订阅支付方式。Play Pass首先在第一年向用户提供每月1.99美元的促销订阅，之后将增加到每月4.99美元。随着早期采用者接近价格变化，谷歌转而给他们一个机会，通过预付一年的订阅费来节省开支。新的年度订阅选项使美国的价格降至每年29.99美元，相当于每月约2.50美元。
本周，现有订户将可以从Android Play Store应用程序的Play Pass选项卡中对年度订阅进行更改。
这项服务还将在国际上推出，本周开始在澳大利亚、加拿大、法国、德国、爱尔兰、意大利、新西兰、西班牙和英国推出。
因为play pass不像以前那样严重依赖独家产品，而且包括非游戏应用程序，所以它能够提供比Apple Arade在发布时更多的产品目录。今天，苹果吹嘘Arade提供了100多款游戏，而谷歌在过去几个月里增加了更多的应用程序。
谷歌还根据Play Pass的下载量将其支出与开发者捆绑在一起，而苹果则为Arade游戏提供了前期资金，并为独家游戏提供了更多资金。iOS开发者也在就他们的协议签署保密协议，但据报道，这里也涉及收入分成。
这两项服务都迎合了越来越多对订阅娱乐感兴趣的观众，这不再局限于流媒体音乐和视频。除了标准的手机游戏收入外，一段时间以来，应用程序订阅一直在推动应用程序商店的消费者支出增长。
Google Play Pass扩展到新市场和(仅限美国)年度订阅选项都将于本周推出。
note_en:
Unlike Apple Arcade, Google Play Pass offered a combination of games and premium apps, like AccuWeather, Facetune and Pic Stitch, for example. It also included a notable list of launch titles, like Stardew Valley, Risk, Terraria, Monument Valley, Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic, Reigns: Game of Thrones, Titan Quest and Wayward Souls.
 The company has been steadily growing its lineup since its debut. Google says that over the past few months, it’s added over 150 titles and is preparing to roll out even more. A series of new titles will also premiere on Google Play Pass this year at launch, starting with the newly-released The Almost Gone from Playdigious, available now. This will be followed by The Gardens Between and Kingdom Rush, then new releases like Bright Paw from Rogue and Line Weight from The Label coming later this year.
    The company is also offering a different way to pay for the subscription. Play Pass first offered users a $1.99 per month promotional subscription for the first year, which would increase to $4.99 per month afterwards. As early adopters are nearing the price change, Google is instead giving them a chance to save by paying for a year’s subscription upfront. The new annual subscription option brings the price down to $29.99 per year in the U.S., which works out to roughly $2.50 per month.
 Existing subscribers will be able to make the change to an annual subscription from the Play Pass tab in the Play Store app for Android this week.
 The service is also launching internationally with availability in Australia, Canada, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, New Zealand, Spain and the United Kingdom, starting this week.
 Because Play Pass didn’t rely as heavily on exclusives and included non-game apps, it was able to offer a larger catalog than Apple Arcade did at launch. Today, Apple  touts that Arcade offers over 100 games, while Google has added more apps than that in just the past several months.
 Google also ties its payouts to developers based on Play Pass downloads, while Apple had offered upfront funding for Arcade titles, with more for exclusives. iOS developers are also under NDA about their agreements, but a revenue share is reportedly involved here, as well.
 Both services cater to a growing audience interested in subscription-based entertainment, which is no longer limited to just streaming music and video. Outside of standard mobile game revenue, app subscriptions have been driving increased in consumer spend across the app stores for some time.
 The Google Play Pass expansion to new markets and the (U.S.-only) annual subscription option are both rolling out this week.
title: Google Play Pass在美国以外扩张，增加更多游戏和年度定价
title_en: Google Play Pass expands outside the U.S., adds more titles and annual pricing

note:
至此，该公司现在总共筹集了3.3亿美元，其中包括2019年1.03亿美元的E系列融资。该公司表示，目前其估值为19.2亿美元。
Auth0的主要客户包括Atlassian、AMD和AutoTrader等。该公司目前拥有650名员工，该公司表示，2019年收入和客户群都增长了70%，现在有“数千名客户”使用这项服务将他们的身份管理外包。
Auth0首席执行官兼联合创始人尤金尼奥·佩斯说：“实现F系列融资对我们公司来说是一个令人难以置信的里程碑，我们非常感谢我们的新投资者和现有投资者的支持。”“几乎每一款应用和服务都依赖于安全认证和无缝的用户体验。我们的同比增长反映了我们的技术正在解决的持续存在的问题，我们为能成为客户旅程的一部分而感到非常自豪。“。
Auth0(发音为auth-Zero)的承诺是，开发人员只需向其应用程序添加几行代码，即可为外部用户添加对其身份管理服务的访问权限，并允许他们自己的员工访问其内部网服务。
Salesforce公司企业发展和Salesforce Ventures执行副总裁John Somorjai说：“Auth0是大型、快速增长的身份管理市场的领先者，在规模上显示出巨大的增长。Auth0在端对端身份产品方面的专业知识与Salesforce的Customer 360平台很好地结合在一起。我们期待着通过Salesforce风险投资公司的这项新战略投资来支持他们的增长，为客户推动进一步的创新。“。
该公司表示，它将利用这笔新资金“推动持续创新和市场扩张”，投资者显然相信，Auth0有能力在身份和访问管理市场占据相当大的份额，尽管这是一个与Okta、Ping Identity、微软(Microsoft)、IBM、甲骨文(Oracle)等公司争夺类似客户池的竞争空间。
note_en:
With this, the company has now raised a total of $330 million, including its  $103 million Series E round in 2019. The company says its valuation is now 1.92 billion.
 Auth0’s marquee customers include the likes of Atlassian, AMD and Autotrader. The company, which now has 650 employees, says it grew both its revenue and customer base by 70 percent in 2019 and that it now has ‘thousands of customers’ who use the service to outsource their identity management.
  “Achieving a Series F round of funding is an incredible milestone for our company, and we could not be more grateful to our new and existing investors for their support,” said Auth0 CEO and co-founder Eugenio Pace. “Nearly every app and service relies on secure authentication and seamless user experience. Our year-over-year growth is reflective of the persistent problem  that our technology is solving, and we are so proud to be part of our customers’ journey.”
 The promise of Auth0 (pronounced auth-zero) is that developers only need to add a few lines of code to their applications to add access to its identity management service for external users and to give their own employees access to their intranet services, too.
 “Auth0 is a leader in the large, fast-growing identity management market and has shown tremendous growth at scale,” said John Somorjai, EVP, Corporate Development &  Salesforce Ventures   at Salesforce. “Auth0’s expertise in end-to-end identity products is well-aligned with Salesforce’s Customer 360 platform. We look forward to supporting their growth with this new strategic investment from Salesforce Ventures to drive further innovation for customers.”
 The company says it will use the new funding to “fuel continued innovation and go-to-market expansion” and the investors clearly believe that Auth0 is in a position to capture a good chunk of the identity and access management market, despite that fact that this is a competitive space with the likes of Okta, Ping Identity, Microsoft, IBM, Oracle and others all vying for a similar pool of customers.
title: 身份平台Auth0以19.亿美元的估值筹集了1.2亿美元的F系列融资
title_en: Identity platform Auth0 raises $120M Series F funding round at $1.92B valuation

title: 创始人最喜爱的风投
title_en: The VCs who founders love the most

note:
谁真正在某一特定领域投资？谁真正在种子期或系列赛阶段开支票？谁真的愿意在任何其他投资者承诺之前领投一轮？
在TechCrunch，这是创始人问我们的最常见的问题之一，也是最具挑战性的问题之一。因此，我们决定发起一项新的倡议，帮助引导创始人找到一些可以帮助催化筹资的投资领袖。我们的目标既简单又大胆：通过给创始人变得越来越不透明的金融环境带来更多透明度，重塑风险投资行业。
TechCrunch榜单是一份经过验证的、经过精心策划的投资者名单，这些投资者表现出了从种子到增长的承诺，从种子到成长，按市场垂直方向组织。
上个月，我们宣布了这份榜单的发布及其背后的使命，之后我们要求创始人提交他们的建议，推荐哪些风投对他们自己的筹资起到了重要作用。这一行动号召得到了大量响应：1200多名创始人提交了他们投资者的推荐，其中数百人提交了段落，有时甚至是几页纸的笔记，说明他们的投资者有多有价值(我们收到的最长的推荐超过14页)。对于那些提交了信息的人-感谢你们将信息转发给其他希望将梦想变成现实的创始人。
我们筛选了所有这数百条建议，再加上来自Crunchbase等来源的补充公开数据，我们构建了最初的第一批检查和主要风险投资人名单。
在这份TechCrunch榜单的初稿中，总共有391名投资者，分为22个不同的垂直领域，如消费者应用程序、企业基础设施、数字生物技术等。
我们还很兴奋地公布了一份11位风投投资者的名单，根据提交给我们的推荐数量和评论深度，他们从创始人那里获得了最热情的推荐。对于一个有时会感觉到交易和残酷的行业来说，创始人的这些声明表明，有时最积极的关系也可能是最有回报的。
我也很高兴地注意到，尽管风投行业在种族和性别多样性方面的记录一直很差，而且还在继续，但创始人似乎特别热衷于强调女性和有色人种对他们的初创企业的承诺。TechCrunch今天发布的榜单包括69名女性(18%)和111名有色人种(28%)，其中包括23名黑人风险资本家(6%)。虽然这些百分比显然远远低于平等水平，但值得注意的是，这些群体的推荐率似乎高于风投行业的平均水平。
归根结底，TechCrunch榜单是一个活生生的名录，列出了愿意引领该行业的最活跃的风投。我们打算定期更新这份榜单，因为创始人给了我们更多的推荐，投资者改变了他们的品味和投资组合。如果你是一位创始人，还没有提交你的推荐信，请随意提交。其他创始人都指望着你的慷慨。
就像所有的产品发布一样，这一举措引起了轰动。执行制片人是丹尼·克莱顿，我们的数据分析师和制片人是Arman Tabatabai。我们的产品团队由Santosh Ankola和Shikha Tandon领导，工程团队由Robin Julius领导，Inversion提供技术协助。我们的业务和营销工作由内德·德斯蒙德、乔伊·辛森和特拉维斯·伯纳德领导。这个项目的插图是由奈杰尔·萨斯曼和布莱斯·德宾设计的。我们感谢整个TechCrunch编辑、产品、工程和业务团队的支持。
如果您的条目需要更正，请发送电子邮件给我们。我们经常遇到的一个问题是围绕我们为每位投资者选择的垂直行业。我们使用公开的数据为每个投资者选择垂直领域，因此，要添加或更改这些垂直领域，请向我们指出您最近在不同垂直领域的活跃投资组合的证据。
我们使用创始人提交的推荐和像Crunchbase这样的公开数据集创建了TechCrunch榜单。虽然我们有相当多的数据要处理，但它绝不是全面的。如果你是一名风险投资家，并且经常给初创公司开第一张支票或领头支票，那就让你的创始人提交一份推荐信，并给TechCrunch发电子邮件，告诉他们关于你最近投资的信息。投资者没有被纳入的最常见原因是缺乏直接可归因于最近的投资。
不是的。我们正在滚动处理所有创始人的推荐，当我们收到新的提交时，我们将发布包含新数据的更新列表。
这份名单似乎是以美国为中心的。你打算扩展到其他地区吗？
是。考虑到我们对硅谷的关注，我们的读者向美国倾斜，因此我们的推荐和数据也是如此。如果您有在欧洲、亚洲、拉丁美洲或非洲的投资数据，请寄给我们。
note_en:
Who really invests in a particular space? Who really writes checks at the seed stage or the Series A? Who really is willing to lead a round before any other investors commit?
 Here at TechCrunch, it’s one of the most common questions founders ask us, and also one of the most challenging questions to answer. So we decided to launch a new initiative to help guide founders to some of the investment leaders who can help catalyze a fundraise. Our goal was both simple and bold:  to reinvent the venture capital industry by bringing more transparency to what has become an ever more opaque financial environment for founders.
  The TechCrunch List is a verified, curated list of investors who have demonstrated a commitment to first checks and leading rounds from seed through growth, organized by market vertical.
 After we announced the launch of the List and the mission behind it last month, we asked founders to submit their recommendations of which VCs were instrumental in their own fundraises. That call to action was abundantly answered:  more than 1,200 founders submitted recommendations of their investors, hundreds of whom submitted paragraphs, and at times, literally pages of notes about how valuable their investors were (the longest recommendation we got was over 14 pages long). For those of you who submitted your information —  thank you for passing it forward to other founders who are hoping to bring their dreams to reality.
  We sifted through all those hundreds of recommendations, and coupled with complementary public data from sources like Crunchbase, we constructed our initial list of first check and lead VCs.
 In all, 391 investors were included in this  initial draft of The TechCrunch List, organized into 22 different verticals like consumer applications, enterprise infrastructure, digital biotech, and more.
 We’re also excited to publish  a list of 11 VC investors who had the most enthusiastic recommendations from founders based on both quantity of recommendations as well as the depth of the comments submitted to us. For an industry that can at times feel transactional and cutthroat, these statements from founders show that sometimes the most positive relationships can also be the most remunerative.
 I am delighted as well to note that while the VC industry has — and continues to have — a poor track record when it comes to diversity across race and gender, founders seem particularly keen to highlight the commitment of women and people of color to their startups.  The TechCrunch List as it stands today at launch includes 69 women (18%) and 111 people of color (28%), including 23 Black venture capitalists (6%). While those percentages are clearly far below equality, it is notable that these groups seem to get recommended at a higher rate than the VC industry average.
 Ultimately, The TechCrunch List is a living and breathing directory of the most active VCs who are willing to lead in the industry.  We intend for the List to be regularly updated as founders give us more recommendations and investors change their tastes and their portfolios. If you are a founder and haven’t  submitted your recommendation, please feel free to do so. Other founders are counting on your generosity.
 As with all product launches, this initiative took a village. The executive producer was Danny Crichton, and our data analyst and producer was Arman Tabatabai. Our product team was led by Santosh Ankola and Shikha Tandon with engineering led by Robin Julius and with technical assistance from  Imversion. Our business and marketing efforts were led by Ned Desmond, Joey Hinson, and Travis Bernard. The illustrations for this project were designed by Nigel Sussman and Bryce Durbin. We thank the whole TechCrunch editorial, product, engineering, and business teams for their support.
   If there is a correction needed to your entry, please  email us. One question we often get is around the vertical(s) we selected for each investor. We use publicly available data to select the verticals for each investor, and so, to add or change these, please point us to evidence of your recent and active portfolio of investments in a different vertical.
  We built The TechCrunch List using submitted recommendations from founders and publicly available datasets like Crunchbase. While we had quite a bit of data to work with, it is by no means comprehensive. If you’re a VC and regularly write first or lead checks into startups, have your founders  submit a recommendation as well as  email TechCrunch with information about your recent investments.  The most common reason an investor wasn’t included is due to a lack of directly attributable recent investments.
  No. We are processing all founder recommendations on a rolling basis, and as we get new submissions, we will publish an updated list with new data.
 The list seems to be U.S.-centric. Are you going to expand out to other geographies?
 Yes. Given our focus on Silicon Valley, our readership skews toward the U.S. and thus our recommendations and data skew that way as well. If you have data on investments in Europe, Asia, Latin America or Africa, please send them our way.
title: 宣布TechCrunch名单，这是一个创始人友好的First Check and Lead风投目录
title_en: Announcing The TechCrunch List, a founder-friendly directory of first check and lead VCs

note:
总部位于华盛顿州贝尔维尤的身份即服务初创公司Auth0今天宣布，它以19.2亿美元的融资后估值筹集了1.2亿美元，高于2019年5月的10亿美元。该公司一位发言人说，这笔资金将用于研发和上市扩张，使Auth0筹集的资金总额超过3.3亿美元。
在线数据泄露事件正在上升，原因并不是什么神秘的事情。在LastPass最近进行的一项调查中，59%的受访者表示，他们在多个账户上重复使用密码，超过一半的受访者表示，他们在过去一年里没有更改过密码。大约95%的网络安全漏洞可归因于这样的人为错误，恶意黑客正在充分利用这一点。据估计，平均每39秒就有一次网络攻击。
Auth0的Identity Platform套件可以部署在云中或内部部署，通过将用户定向到集中式授权服务器的通用流程支持单点登录(SSO)。如果所有其他方法都失败了，该公司会通过检查“数亿”被泄露凭证的数据库来实时检测密码泄露。受影响的用户会通过电子邮件或文本自动通知，Auth0为管理员提供了在重置密码之前阻止访问的选项。
Auth0拥有与流行平台和协议的集成，如Google Suite、Microsoft的Azure Active Directory和Active Directory联合服务(ADFS)、轻量级目录访问协议(LDAP)，甚至Facebook、Twitter、WordPress、GitHub和PayPal。它的账户链接功能可以整合不同提供商的重复用户名，Auth0允许客户通过自定义品牌域名以及可以嵌入到应用程序中的网络和移动登录小工具Lock定制身份验证体验。
在管理方面，Auth0的仪表板允许控制用户帐户提供(和删除)、权限和身份提供程序，并提供对身份验证、设备、登录历史记录和位置日志的完全可见性，以供审核和调试。此外，该公司提供的工具可以显示个性化用户目标的数据，并实现对社交登录、多因素身份验证和基于每个应用的异常检测等功能的控制。
Auth0的其他Spotlight服务包括一个强大的规则生成器，可以自动执行验证、电子邮件和应用程序认证等操作。该公司的无密码小工具允许用户通过短信或电子邮件在没有密码的情况下登录，其iOS和Android版的Guardian应用程序使用户能够通过点击按钮进行身份验证或拒绝登录请求。
预计到2025年，身份和访问市场的价值将达到226.8亿美元，Auth0并不是唯一一个这样的市场。总部位于纽约的Socure在2019年2月因其基于云的身份验证和防欺诈解决方案获得了3000万美元。去年4月，全球身份验证提供商Onfido刚刚筹集了5000万美元，陷入困境的身份管理公司Jumio最近找到了更稳定的立足点，并推出了一款新的身份验证产品。最近，身份和证书验证公司Visible赚了2000万美元。
但Auth0断言，竞争对手缺乏其规模和健壮性。该公司声称，到目前为止，它已经阻止了超过130万次恶意登录，正常运行时间为99.9%，每天处理8000万至10亿笔交易，每月处理超过40亿次登录(高于2019年5月的25亿和2018年5月的15亿)。目前和过去的知名客户包括Mozilla、PBS、Arduino、Atlassian、西门子、NVIDIA、哈佛医学院、新闻集团、哈珀柯林斯、Mozilla、Nando‘s、Talbots、AMD、NVIDIA、Tableau、施耐德电气、FuboTV，以及70多个国家和地区的7000多家其他公司。
着眼于增长，Auth0去年年底在新加坡开设了一个办事处，作为东南亚客户获取和支持的运营中心。今年3月，该公司收购了Apility.io，一家反滥用API公司Auth0表示，这将有助于加强其安全战略，以防范自动网络攻击。就在今年春天，Auth0聘请了前AWS渠道负责人Jason Teo来领导其在亚太地区的努力。
Auth0联合创始人兼首席执行官尤金尼奥·佩斯(Eugenio Pace)在一份声明中表示：“实现F系列融资对我们公司来说是一个令人难以置信的里程碑，我们非常感谢我们的新投资者和现有投资者的支持。”“几乎每一款应用和服务都依赖于安全认证和无缝的用户体验。我们的同比增长反映了我们的技术正在解决的持续存在的问题，我们为能成为客户旅程的一部分而感到非常自豪。“。
Salesforce Ventures在Auth0中领导了这轮F系列融资，DTCP以及Bessemer Venture Partners、Sapphire Ventures、Meritech Capital、World Innovation Lab、Trinity Ventures、Telstra Ventures和K9 Ventures都参与了这轮融资。该公司目前在华盛顿州贝尔维尤总部以及布宜诺斯艾利斯、伦敦、悉尼和东京的办事处雇佣了约650名员工(去年5月为475人)。
note_en:
Bellevue, Washington-based identity-as-a-service startup  Auth0 today announced it raised $120 million at a post-money valuation of $1.92 billion, up from $1 billion in May 2019. A company spokesperson said the funds, which bring  Auth0’s total raised to over $330 million, will be put toward R&D and go-to-market expansion efforts.
 Online data breaches are on the rise, and it’s no great mystery why. In a recent survey conducted by LastPass, 59% of respondents said they reused passwords across multiple accounts, and more than half said they hadn’t changed their password in the past year. About 95% of cybersecurity breaches are attributable to human errors like these, and malicious hackers are taking full advantage. It’s estimated that there’s a cyberattack every 39 seconds on average.
  Auth0’s identity platform suite, which can be deployed in the cloud or on-premises, supports single sign-on (SSO) through a universal flow that directs users to a centralized authorization server. If all else fails, the company detects password compromise in real time by checking against a database of “hundreds of millions” of breached credentials. Affected users are notified automatically via email or text, and Auth0 gives admins the option of preventing access until after they reset their passwords.
 Auth0 boasts integrations with popular platforms and protocols like Google Suite, Microsoft’s Azure Active Directory and Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS), Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP), and even Facebook, Twitter, WordPress, GitHub, and PayPal. Its account-linking feature can consolidate duplicate user names across providers, and Auth0 allows customers to customize the authentication experience with custom-branded domains and a web and mobile login widget — Lock — that can be embedded within apps.
 On the management side of things, Auth0’s dashboards afford control over user account provisioning (and deletion), permissions, and identity providers and offer full visibility into authentication, device, login history, and location logs for auditing and debugging. Moreover, the company delivers tools that surface data for personalized user targeting and that enable control over features like social logins, multi-factor authentication, and anomaly detection on a per-app basis.
 Auth0’s other spotlight services include a powerful rule builder that automates things like verification emails and app authentication. The company’s Passwordless widget lets users login without a password via SMS or email, and its Guardian app for iOS and Android enables them to authenticate themselves or deny login requests with the tap of a button.
  Auth0 isn’t alone in an identity and access market that’s anticipated to be worth $22.68 billion by 2025. New York-based Socure nabbed $30 million in February 2019 for its cloud-based identity verification and fraud prevention solution. Global identity verification provider Onfido raised $50 million just last April, and troubled identity management firm Jumio recently found more stable footing and launched a  new authentication product. More recently, identity and credentials verification firm Evident raked in $20 million.
 But Auth0 asserts that rivals lack its scale and robustness. The company claims to have prevented over 1.3 million malicious logins to date with 99.9% uptime, and it handles between 80 million and 1 billion transactions every day and more than 4 billion logins per month (an increase from 2.5 billion in May 2019 and 1.5 billion in May 2018). Current and past high-profile customers include Mozilla, PBS, Arduino, Atlassian, Siemens, Nvidia, Harvard Medical School, News Corp, HarperCollins, Mozilla, Nando’s, Talbots, AMD, Nvidia, Tableau, Schneider Electric, FuboTV, and over 7,000 others in more than 70 countries.
 With an eye toward growth, Auth0 late last year opened an office in Singapore to serve as an operations hub for customer acquisition and support in Southeast Asia. In March, the company acquired Apility.io, an anti-abuse API company Auth0 says will help bolster its security strategy to protect against automated cyberattacks. And just this spring, Auth0 hired former AWS channel head Jason Teo to lead its efforts in the Asia Pacific region.
 “Achieving a Series F round of funding is an incredible milestone for our company, and we could not be more grateful to our new and existing investors for their support,” Auth0 cofounder and CEO Eugenio Pace said in a statement. “Nearly every app and service relies on secure authentication and seamless user experience. Our year-over-year growth is reflective of the persistent problem  that our technology is solving, and we are so proud to be part of our customers’ journey.”
 Salesforce Ventures led this series F round in Auth0, with participation from DTCP as well as Bessemer Venture Partners, Sapphire Ventures, Meritech Capital, World Innovation Lab, Trinity Ventures, Telstra Ventures, and K9 Ventures. The company now employs around 650 people (up from 475 as of last May) across its Bellevue, Washington headquarters and offices in Buenos Aires, London, Sydney, and Tokyo.
title: 总部位于华盛顿的身份即服务初创公司Auth0以Salesforce Ventures为首的F系列融资1.2亿美元，融资后估值为19.2亿美元，高于2019年5月的10亿美元
title_en: Washington-based identity-as-a-service startup Auth0 raises $120M Series F led by Salesforce Ventures at a $1.92B post-money valuation, up from $1B in May 2019
